Document Details
You are my wife. Due to the great love I have for you, the land acquired by my ancestors and inherited by me as a vacant land, I have purchased the land with my own money and have purchased the land with my own money. Having constructed a slab house and having a house tax receipt in my name in the Gram Panchayat, I have full right and possession of the following immovable property, valued at Rs. 4,67,000.00 in characters, and having the R.C.C. slab house built on the said land, I hereby transfer the said land to you on this day, and I hereby transfer the said land to you on this day, and I hereby transfer the said land to you on this day. You shall retain the said property from now on in your possession and enjoy it with all the rights of donation, exchange, sale and possession as you wish, paying the Gram Panchayat tax etc. In order to enjoy it, neither you nor your heirs nor I nor my heirs shall ever have to cause any dispute or hindrance. I hereby assure you that the said property as per the schedule is my undisputed property and that I have not done any illegal acts to anyone before and I hereby issue a deed of title in your name on this day. I will resolve all disputes and disputes arising from the said property at my own expense and keep this deed of title for you without any hindrance. In order to transfer the property in your name as per the schedule, a notice form has been filed with the Gram Panchayat. This property is not an assignment. This property does not belong to the Government or its affiliated institutions and is not a property on which the above institutions have securities or mortgages. In case of any dispute, the Government shall refer to the Indian Stamp Act, Andhra Pradesh Amendment Act No. 16/2002, if there is any deficiency in payment of stamp duty, the original stamp
A Veerababu

I hereby certify that I am a person who is able to pay a penalty of three times the actual stamp duty in case of less than the duty paid. I hereby declare that I have duly stated in the deed the full facts relating to the levy of stamp duty, the consideration and the market value of the property, and that if I fail to act as provided in section 27 of the Indian Stamp Act, 1899, I hereby consent to the prosecution of the said deed under section 70 for the recovery of the said amount by imposing penalty and stamp duty as may be regularly payable from me under sections 64 and 64A. In pursuance of Section 21 of the Indian Registration Act, 1908, I have enclosed with the plan all the particulars necessary for the identification of the property, including the boundaries, door number, full address etc. I have read and heard all the matters herein in full in the presence of the witnesses below. I hereby acknowledge that all these are as stated by me and that the scribe has written as I have said. This is a deed of transfer of the immovable property, the R.C.C. slab Daba house built on the said land, written and given under my consent.
A Veerababu

Palnadu District, Narasaraopet Registration District, 'Gurajala Sub-Registrar's Office, I have the right to the land I have registered in the village of Rajanagar, Nidanampadu, which is included in the Gram Panchayat of Nidanampadu, Durgi Mandal, having the old assessment number 201 built on the said land and the current R.C.C. having the current assessment number 1-201 as per the revision of the Gram Panchayat. The boundaries of the slab patio house.
East:- Chalancharla Sambasivarao's house in this direction measuring 31.7 feet
South:- Kattupalli Prasad's house in this direction measuring 41.4 feet
West:- Panchayat Bazaar in this direction measuring 31.7 feet
North:- Kattupalli Prasad's place in this direction measuring 41.4 feet
The area between these boundaries is 1305.20 sq. ft. i.e. 145.02 sq. yd. i.e. 121.25 sq. m., on the said place, there is an R.C.C. slab terrace house built about 2 years ago measuring 215 sq. ft. and all the wooden furniture attached to the said property. I hereby hand over to you the R.C.C. slab terrace house and give it to you as my possession today. This property is in survey number 45 of Nidanpadu village taluk.

Declaration
This declaration is to inform that in the preparation of this document, we have brought all the necessary documents such as property details, tax receipts for the places/houses, details of the parties in the document, addresses of the parties, property details etc. and we have thoroughly examined all the aspects and have included them in this document and have got the document prepared. No matter that should have been written or included in this document has been omitted. After physically inspecting the Scheduled Property, taking measurements and taking E.C. of the said Property as per Section-22B, it has been ascertained that the said Property has not been mortgaged, sold or encumbered to anyone and this document has been registered. And we are fully responsible for the depreciation stamp and all other matters found in the future during the inspection of the said Property by the authorities (Registration & Stamps and Revenue Department). sections.content:
The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 469 of 2026, dated 29/Jan/2026, executed by Alluri Veerababu in favour of his Wife, Alluri Adilakshmi towards the property admeasuring an extent of 145.02 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 1-201, Old Assessment No. 201, New Assessment No. 200158000201, comprised in survey number 45, situated in Nidanampadu Sivar Rajanagaram Village, Nidanampadu Grama Panchayati and Durgi Mandal, within the District of Palnadu, registered at sub-registrar office Gurajala, is bounded as follows:

North by: Kattupalli Prasad Site – 41.4 Ft
South by: Kattupalli Prasad House – 41.4 Ft
East by: Chalamcherla Sambasiva Rao House – 31.7 Ft
West by: Panchayathi Bazar – 31.7 Ft
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the scheduled property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
